attributes.action: Build and repair road surfaces using the plastic waste produced in the UK
attributes.background: Households in the UK produce 22 million tonnes of waste per year and only 44% is recycled. Our country keeps exporting our waste (particularly plastic) to other far shores. Since China have introduced a ban against this, the government are searching for new places to export.
attributes.additional_details: The Netherlands have recently introduced the usage of recycled plastics in the re-surfacing and building of road surfaces. Not only does it recycle the waste that we create, but it also reduces CO2 damage caused by the original asphalt. This surface can withstand extreme temperatures from -40 degrees to 80 degrees. Many road surfaces desperately require repair and this is a quick, simple solution that forces our country to take responsibility for our negative environmental impact.

attributes.action: Make garden bonfires and any external fires illegal without a permit.
attributes.background: Bonfire smoke is a health risk for people with asthma & breathing problems. Wind will distribute smoke over a wide area, especially in steep sided valleys. It is a basic human right to have access to clean, breathable air. Environmentally safe waste disposal is universally available in the UK.

attributes.action: Change the methods the Government use to record Homelessness
attributes.background: The methods currently used by the Government to record Homelessness portray unrealistic results. Many people are concealed in the 'hidden homelessness' category as they sofa surf or move around on the streets. Current figures are an underestimate, many are not included in the official statistics.
attributes.additional_details: Many people who the average citizen would classify as homeless are neglected from the record as they do not fit Government criteria. We cannot ignore the lives of individuals simply because they are not "lying down in the street" and instead are hiding in the crevice of a doorway. If the Government change the way they record homelessness to give a more representative statistic, as a united country we can tackle this issue with full knowledge of what we are facing.

attributes.action: Make sure that there are recycling bins in the classrooms of every school.
attributes.background: As a student, everyday I see a shocking amount of paper go to landfill. I understand that in the current environmental climate, we should be doing all we can to create minimal waste. By ensuring there are recycling bins in every classroom teachers and students could be compelled to act.
attributes.additional_details: Every day students are using worksheets and paper in lesson, however, instead of putting used paper in a recycling bin it is put in the normal bins to go to landfill. I find this shocking, I myself believe that recycling is such an easy way to prevent waste going to landfill sites. There is an easy way to combat this problem, by ensuring every classroom in every school across the country has a recycling bin, many more teachers and students could be compelled to recycle their paper.

attributes.action: Issue an official apology to Lauren Southern for denial of entry into the UK
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern was detained in Calais by Kent police and charged under section 7 of the terrorism act, before being denied entry into the UK.

The Government must apologise for this.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that that section 7 was wrongfully applied as Section 41 states that "A constable may arrest without a warrant a person whom he reasonably suspects to be a terrorist." I do not believe that the police believed Lauren Southern to be a terrorist.

attributes.action: A petition to action Government to posthumously pardon all Suffragettes
attributes.background: From 1900 to the beginning of WW1 approximately 1,000 women were imprisoned in the British campaign to gain the votes for women.These women suffered and sacrificed a lifetime for generations today to live an equal life.These women should be posthumously pardoned and celebrated for their bravery.
attributes.additional_details: As a relative of Emmeline Pankhurst there has never been a more appropriate time to pursue the notion of having suffragettes that were imprisoned during the Votes for Women campaign posthumously pardoned and their efforts celebrated. Despite the peaceful efforts of Millicent Fawcett, Emmeline and her daughters at the start of the campaign, progress was slow and their voices dampened. Many courageous women pushed the campaign forward in a way that ensured their voices were heard 'Votes for Women'

attributes.action: Make it a crime to remove dairy calves' teats without anaesthetic & pain relief
attributes.background: Many dairy calves have extra or "supernumerary" teats removed with a scalpel or scissors. It is only "recommended" to provide anaesthetic. Not legally required to provide anaesthetic and pain relief medication afterwards
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see the following links
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf
http://adlib.everysite.co.uk/adlib/defra/content.aspx?id=000IL3890W.182WIKRB434ZN7
http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2009/06/18114130/10

attributes.action: Make employers offer part-time working for new parents
attributes.background: Lots of parents who worked full time before having children are unable to do so once the child is born. At present employers are allowed to consider part-time options but they do not have to honour them leaving new mums and dads no option but to resign. The same job level should also be available.
attributes.additional_details: Returning to a role after having a baby is difficult enough, it seems that if you want part-time you have to fight for it and if it is granted the job level you were at before is not always made available to you. I believe that it should be compulsory to offer a part time role at the same level. Parents should not be penalised in the workplace for having a child.

attributes.action: A commemorative plaque for the contributions made by the Windrush Generation.
attributes.background: As a result of the recent  negative treatment of the Windrush Generation,   we should instead  acknowledge their invaluable contributions to the successes of British life over the years.

attributes.action: Utility companies to be responsible for repairing potholes around poor repairs
attributes.background: A majority of potholes form around places of existing weakness, such as road repair works following companies digging up the roads for routine maintenance.  These companies should be responsible for filling any potholes that are a consequence of a road weakness following their actions
attributes.additional_details:
Potholes are caused when water penetrates cracks in the road. When this water freezes, it expands, widening the cracks. When it melts, traffic smashes new craters into the road surface.  Other countries do not have many drains and services under their roads, and do not give privatised utility companies the right to dig up a new road
An increasing number of road users are taking legal action. The AA estimates that the cost to insurers of claims (pothole damage) was £2.85m during February alone.

attributes.action: Make Battle of Britain Day, the 15th of September, a public holiday.
attributes.background: Let the 15th of September as "Battle of Britain Day" be made a public holiday to celebrate that one day in the field of human conflict that represents that grand singularity of the unity of purpose of the diverse peoples of this great nation that says 'together we are'.
attributes.additional_details:
The Battle of Britain, as fought between the 10th of July and the 31st of October, 1940, was summed up by Winston Churchill with the words "Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few". 

On the 15th of September, 1940, the Luftwaffe embarked on its largest bombing attack yet, which required the engagement of the entirety of the RAF in defence of London and the South East, resulting in a decisive British victory that marked the turning point in Britain's favour.

attributes.action: Minimum of 10 years for causing death by careless or dangerous driving
attributes.background: Too many people are being killed by drivers being drunk, on drugs or using mobile phones will driving.

attributes.action: Ban plastic cotton buds
attributes.background: The sale and manufacture of plastic-stemmed cotton buds is to be banned under new Scottish government plans. England should follow suit as the plastic stems of cotton buds kill 1000s of marine species every year along the coastline.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish government can take action and ban plastic being used to make cotton buds so can we. People flush plastic cotton buds down the toilet and many end up in the ocean and as a result they are washed up on our beaches. Not only is this devastating for ecosystems but also for the health of our beautiful coastline. With alternatives such as paper cotton buds available, there is really no need to use plastic.

attributes.action: Make It Mandatory for Employers to Educate Employees on "Employment Rights"
attributes.background:
Discrimination at work is a harsh reality of British Labour Market. This is mainly due to lack of training among the employers and lack of understanding of rights among the employees. 
The only way to protect ourselves and next generation is to make it mandatory for employers to educate their staff
attributes.additional_details:
Equality and Human Rights Commission on 21/12/2017 reported that ethnic minorities have a 12.9% higher unemployment rate.

Black workers with degrees earn 23.1% less on average.

In Britain, only 8.8% of the minorities worked at a manager level or higher.

Based on GOV statistics from Jan-Sep 2017:
13% of the jurisdictional complaints were related to Equal Pay
11.7% for discrimination of some kind.

These numbers are alarming!

So please sign the petition and protect our rights.EDUCATE EMPLOYEES

attributes.action: Government to take the European Commission to the ECJ for misconstruing Art 50.
attributes.background: In Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon there is no mention of monetary reparation for leaving, continual jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice, continual rights of European citizens in the departing territory, or soft annexation of its sovereign territory
attributes.additional_details: Mr Juncker and Mr Barnier seem to want to penalise the UK because of Brexit. But the Treaty of Lisbon makes no particular obligations on leaving countries. If the Treaty envisaged continual supremacy of the ECJ over national courts after departure, or continual freedom of movement for European citizens in the departing country after departure it should have been a treaty provision rather than implied by latter day negotiators.

attributes.action: Make typing and full keyboard skills a compulsory part of secondary education.
attributes.background:
Children today are having to do much of their education online and on computers.  Yet they are not taught to type properly.  This leads to slow work and frustration.  
We do not give a child a pencil and expect them to learn to write. Yet we give them a keyboard and expect them to learn to type.

attributes.action: Reform the Honours System
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that the Honours System has deviated from its true purpose of rewarding individuals for their personal bravery, achievements, or service to the United Kingdom and the British Overseas Territories.
attributes.additional_details: We further believe that the Honours System has been tainted by becoming the object of cronyism by those in positions of power or influence and therefore call upon the British Government to reform the honours system so that Members of Parliament (both in the House of Commons and House of Lords) and others in a position of influence are barred from making nominations, which should only reflect the wishes private citizens for someone to receive an honour for a truly meaningful service to the country or their local community.

attributes.action: Make branding or freeze branding of animals a criminal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Many horses and cattle in the UK are branded using heated iron or frozen metal (freeze branding). This is cruel, causing severe pain and is unnecessary when micro-chipping is cheap and quick. It could even be made illegal without new legislation by enforcing existing anti-cruelty laws.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information
https://www.rspca.org.uk/adviceandwelfare/pets/horses/health/identification
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/

attributes.action: Invest more money in youth charities and youth service providers in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a profound reduction in services for young people resulting from funding cuts. With huge pressures on all local authority budgets, these cuts won’t be reversed. We have to support the organisations who help young people from areas with high levels of deprivation and low income backgrounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2012, in London alone at least £22 million has been cut from council youth service budgets and 12,700 places for young people have been lost. The average council has cut its youth service budget by nearly £1 million, an average of 36%. (London's Lost Youth Services, 2017).

Across the country more than 1 in 10 think their life will amount to nothing, no matter how hard they try. 42% of young people feel traditional goals like getting a steady job are unrealistic (Prince's Trust, 2017).

attributes.action: Stop Reducing our Armed Forces and Spend 3% of GDP. CUT AID to 0.3% to fund it.
attributes.background: When I say "reduce" I mean in three ways: Funding, manpower & resources and credibility. We're told the Government spends 2% of GDP on defence and we have "the second largest budget in NATO... Largest in Europe". Then why can't we even match the French in capability anymore? Spend 3% GDP on Defence.
attributes.additional_details: France has 23 Destroyers and Frigates. We've 19. They've 3 Amphibious ships. We've 2 which are now going to be scrapped. Their Army is 30,000 bigger. You now want to cut another 14,000 and are talking about merging two extremely distinct units: Royal Marines and Parachute Regiment. It's a joke. You don't want the Army to "Be the Best" and the new adverts are laughable. Recruits join for war fighting, adventure and service. Not for PC. That 2% clearly feels like 1% and those in charge are inept.

attributes.action: Ban the shooting of Pheasants, Partridges and Grouse for sport.
attributes.background: 35 Million "game birds" are placed into the countryside annually for shooting, disrupting the environmental balance.  Native wildlife is killed to increase the number of game birds available for shooting. Damage to the environment and suffering to native species and to the game birds is unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: The the introduction of a tens millions of non-native birds upsets the environmental balance of our countryside increasing competition, especially for food amongst native birds. Wildlife such as foxes, crows, magpies, badgers and weasels are directly or indirectly affected by shooting, snaring, trapping and illegal poisoning carried out by gamekeepers. Additionally, the loss of predator species does in itself further disrupt the local wildlife balance as species such as rodents can then thrive.

attributes.action: Change 30 free hour childcare to a monthly sign-up and not a term sign-up.
attributes.background: Parents who get a full time job need to then put their child into care immediately, so need the support immediately and not on a term by term basis, you can't sign up when you don't have a job but when you do, you have to wait until the new term starts. If this was monthly it would make sense.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring NHS Trusts to release patient records within 21 days
attributes.background: Currently, there are significant variations between NHS trusts as to how long they will take to release patient records when requested. We, the undersigned, call on the government to standardise this in law to 21 days, as for many people accessing their medical records is potentially time critical

attributes.action: Ban snares because animals suffer terrible injuries and deaths
attributes.background: Snares are compared to landmines for the indiscriminate way in which these wire traps capture a wide range of animals – from foxes to family pets to protected species. A snare is an archaic thin metal wire noose intended to catch animals by lassoing and trapping them.
attributes.additional_details:
Snares are mainly set on shooting estates to stop foxes from catching the 'game' birds. Britain is one of the few European countries where so-called free-running snares are still used and most countries have banned them. 
The Government believes that snare use can be controlled by a Code of Practice - but this is impossibly to enforce! 
One council has banned snares to protect British wildlife - https://www.league.org.uk/news/council-bans-snares-to-protect-british-wildlife.

attributes.action: Please keep our Island Studio school OPEN in East Cowes Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
Do NOT CLOSE this school. 
If the current proprietors cannot or will not continue running it, then allow SOMEONE ELSE to run it.
We need diversity of opportunity.
But start at a lower age so children can choose to go to have their full secondary education at this school. Make it 11-19, not 14-19.

attributes.action: Introduce a new system to ensure that roads are maintained to a safe standard.
attributes.background: Despite a legal requirement for roads to be maintained to a safe standard, highway authorities have been allowed to put lives at risk by letting many roads become unsafe. Urgent action is needed now to remedy this and a new system needed to prevent this from happening in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation and guidance on road maintenance lie with the Highways Act 1980 and the Well-Maintained Highways: Code of Practice, respectively. Both these require that roads should be maintained in a safe condition but this is clearly not happening. Individuals can go through the process of suing for damage or injury but this has proved inadequate in preventing roads being allowed to deteriorate into a dangerous state. There is a clear lack of accountability and an absence of desire on behalf of the government to implement the requirements of existing legislation and guidance. A new system is therefore required to ensure that safe standards are set and that these standards are met.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and put the money into road repairs and improvement.
attributes.background:
Pot holes are causing serious damage to vehicles and injury to road users such cyclists and motorcyclists. All are at serious risk.

So cancel HS2 with its budget of £15 billion and put the money to work right away on the roads. That will benefit more people than a high speed rail link.

attributes.action: Male & Female employees should be treated the same when on shared parental leave
attributes.background:
Because of the Equality Act 2010 woman and men should have the same company benefits as equal pay.
At the moment companies can offer a enhanced maternity pay that benefits only women can opt not to offer the same benefits to male employees wanting to take Shared Paternal Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment there isn't any legal requirement, with some cases people making a claim that they are being treated less favourable than women on the same company and/or job, some being successful and some not.
Some companies use the technicality that male employee on shared parental leave is treated no less favourably than a female employee on shared parental leave while they offer enhaced maternity pay a benefit only available to womans.

attributes.action: Debate scrapping the television licence fee and discuss other funding options.
attributes.background: We currently pay £147 per year for a TV licence, the bulk of which goes to the BBC, very little BBC programming these days is of the quality expected, please debate in the Commons with regards scrapping this fee and discuss more viable funding options.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health services exempt from VAT.
attributes.background: Mental Health services such as Addiction Counselling (Food, Drugs, Alcohol etc), Psychotherapy and Trauma Counselling currently are all deemed as VATable expenses which makes them a “Luxury Item” this means that Thousands of people are having to pay extra for the help they desperately need!
attributes.additional_details: Currently services such as Equine Therapy, Art Therapy and Speech Therapy are all VAT Exempt so why not important potentially life saving/ changing services? If this government is serious about helping people with mental health issues then drop the VAT and help to make the services they need more affordable.

attributes.action: Serious injuries caused by careless driving should lead to imprisonment.
attributes.background: People's lives are completely changed for the worst due to drivers lack of care on the road. Victims of this often result there pain in suicide, leaving a large strain on not only the victims' lives but the people around them.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers do not deserve to walk away freely from the pain they have caused.

attributes.action: Offer legal aid for all women/ men who have been a victim of domestic abuse
attributes.background: Legal aid is not currently available to all domestic abuse survivors. There are very specific conditions you must meet to be valid, which does not take into consideration any financial abuse or manipulation, which has left a lot of victims struggling to pay off debt and get divorced at the same time

attributes.action: Stop the purchase of gas boilers and associated parts without a registration.
attributes.background: If the law stated, that selling and buying both domestic and commercial Gas, Oil and LPG boilers and associated parts, without governing body registrations became law, the dangerous practice of unqualified and dangerous installations would cease. Thus improving the safety for all and save lives.

attributes.action: Prohibit filibustering and similar forms of sabotage to the democratic process.
attributes.background: Certain MPs have been subverting democracy by using filibustering and other procedural technicalities to prevent reasoned intellectual debate of bills in the House of Commons. This is an affront to the parliamentary process and brings our country’s politics into disrepute.

attributes.action: To stop companies selling debts to debt collection companies
attributes.background: Want it so companies eg mobile phone companies can’t sell a debt on to debt companies who then add extortionate charges and use heavy handed tactics. The contract is between the company and the person who takes out the contract, making that contract a legal document.

attributes.action: Add teaching of CPR and basic lifesaving skills to the teaching syllabus
attributes.background: Many lives could potentially be saved if more individuals within the U.K. knew how to correctly carry out CPR and had the knowledge of basic lifesaving skills. Include these topics in the primary & secondary national curriculum to save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Compulsory mental health education in school.
attributes.background: We need to promote good mental health practices in the same way we promote good physical health.

attributes.action: Provide training to all NHS GP's and Health Visitors on the baby and child sleep
attributes.background: To provide all NHS GP's and Health visitors with an accurate basic knowledge on baby and child sleep. Sleep deprivation is one of the biggest causes of mental health problems in parents and the advice given is very mixed, inaccurate and could cause families more harm.
attributes.additional_details:
GP's and Health Visitors all seem to have different ideas on baby and child sleep. This ranges from:
How much sleep they should have,
When they should wake from their last nap,
Starting solids to get babies to sleep,
Using Piriton (drugging them),
Letting them cry themselves to sleep,
Assuming all babies and children will just fall asleep when they are tired,
Cutting naps from already sleep deprived infants,
Yes, I have heard all of these. Science and research needs to be taken into account now.

attributes.action: Ensure money raised from new sugar levy is divided between education and the NHS
attributes.background:
The Government recently introduced the sugar levy on soft drinks to try and tackle the growing problem of obesity in the UK. The legislation doesn’t specify where the money raised should be spent.
We would like legislation created to ensure that any money raised is given to the NHS and to education
attributes.additional_details: The levy on soft drinks is expected to raise over £274 million pounds which could be used to help fund the struggling NHS budget and also fund sport activities for school children.

attributes.action: Help me to deport my little brother from a Singaporean prison back to the UK
attributes.background: In the November of 2016 19 year old Lorenzo Dentamaro, was arrested in Singapore on accusations of fraud. He spent 6 months on bail battling the case only to be made an example of and harshly served with 3 years inprisomment. He is currently in 16 man cell, suffering in 30 plus temperatures.
attributes.additional_details: My family is suffering, I have grandparents that are very old and may never have the opportunity to see him again. We have to travel 13 hours to see him for only 20 minutes and I just want to bring him back home so he can complete his sentence in the UK. My mother is depressed, our lives have been impacted serverely and I am constantly living on breaking point. I just want to bring him home.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to purposely waste ambulance time & resources.
attributes.background:
Recently an ambulance service rushed to attend to a man claiming to have had a stroke, only to find out he made it up so he could get a free lift. 

Unfortunately the service has said it has to deal with ‘day in day out’ and that unfortunately there is no law against wasting ambulance time.

attributes.action: Include courses on the awareness of terminal illnesses in schools
attributes.background: Include courses in the PSHE curriculum to teach children about terminal illnesses in our schools, and how to deal with them.
attributes.additional_details: Many children do not know how to react to and deal with a family member, friend, or themselves being diagnosed with terminal illnesses such as cancer.

attributes.action: Make Greyhound racing illegal in the U.K .
attributes.background: Greyhound racing must be banned in the U.K. This "sport" remains legal in 8 countries and one of them is the U.K. The sport is inhumane and over 10,000 greyhounds vanish/die every year. This is why we believe it has to stop . #YouBetTheyDie #NoGreyhoundRacing
attributes.additional_details: Greyhound racing is a popular industry here in the U.K. Beautiful dogs race at ground-scaring speeds; the thrill making quick quid off a brutal bet - this all entices many dog-racing enthusiasts, betters and gamblers alike. However, the reality is greyhound-racing is cruel and disgusting. Over 10,000 greyhounds a year are tossed aside due to being "useless". Around 8,000 of these are retired. These poor dogs are then left to starve, abandoned, murdered, sold for dissection purposes and worse.

attributes.action: Improve the transition from mental health child service to adult
attributes.background: As it stands the mental health services in the UK discharge young people at the age of 18 and in some cases even 17 and move them onto the adult services. This process is in most cases tricky and many get lost in the system. The system needs a change to help the people who need it.

attributes.action: Allow working parents free childcare ALL YEAR up to the age of 10.
attributes.background: Working a full time job and having children is hard!  Reagrdless of whether you are single or a couple. The general work place gives 23ish days holiday while children are given 11 weeks,  with no family network to rely on childcare is very costly, almost to the point of it not being worth working.
attributes.additional_details:
You feel guilty if you do work and guilty if you dont! If you want us to work and input into society, help us!
It would be easier to go on benfits and watch my children grow up. 
Help is really needed here! So many people are working just to pay for childcare not to mention how many must be left alone.
Let us have a quality of life with our children.

attributes.action: Make UK standard parking spaces bigger.
attributes.background: Parking space is a premium in most cities and towns. However, most spaces are barely wider than a vehicle. A UK standard parking space is 2.4m wide, by 4.8m. The average family car is 2.1m x 4.8m. Park perfectly and you get 150mm either side to open a door. This is not enough for most vehicle users.
attributes.additional_details:
You should be able to park your vehicle and get in or out without struggling. You should also not have to worry about potential damage which can often be sustained in your absence. Causing needless cost and loss of earnings, maybe even insurance hikes. Town and city planners have overlooked this for years, as have Supermarkets and retail parks.
It's time, as consumers, that we took a stand and put the onus onto those profiting from our misery.
Your vote could help to change this.

attributes.action: Cap council tax at 2% per annum maximum from 2019 onwards
attributes.background:
Many pensioners and early retirees have fixed incomes (annuity pensions).
The last two years have seen an 11% increase in council tax which is proving increasingly difficult to pay.

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown’s ban from the U.K. and allow him access to the country.
attributes.background: Global sensation and pop-culture figure, Chris Brown was publicly banned from entering the United Kingdom in 2009 following his domestic abuse and violent history towards then girlfriend, Rihanna. I believe that the ban should be lifted almost 10 years on so Brown can come and perform in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details: My knowledge from the Daily Mail and love for Chris Brown are my references.

attributes.action: Ban exams, instead get graded for classwork.
attributes.background: Because many people have anxiety, and this would help them from getting through this. Usually children to much better in class than under exam conditions.

attributes.action: Amend the knife law: Ban drop point blades and thumb studs.
attributes.background: Knife crime is a serious problem in our nation. Drop and clip point blades (blades with a point designed to achieve greater penetration when used to stab) and thumb studs (nubs of metal that allow a knife to be rapidly opened with one hand) should be banned to reduce the severity of knife attacks.
attributes.additional_details:
Current knife law is designed around preventing stabbings and keeping our streets safe. (https://www.gov.uk/buying-carrying-knives) Drop and clip point knives are not restricted under this law. These knife types are designed to cause worse stab wounds. (https://www.knife-depot.com/knife-information-105.html, https://www.knife-depot.com/knife-information-104.html)
Thumb studs (also legal) convert knives into switchblades in all but name. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zCMe1q8MY8)
